_header: Fresh amorous sights of country fair and strange
Note:
Davis (1971)
XDavis, Norman. The Paston Letters and Papers of the Fifteenth Century. 2 vols. Oxford: Clarendon, 1971, 1976; Gairdner (1904)
XGairdner, James. The Paston Letters. 6 vols. London: Chatto & Windus, 1904; repr. Alan Sutton, 1986.
Subjects: letters; Paston, John, sir; Pympe, John
_description: Letter from John Pympe to Sir John Paston in France 1477 — five stanzas rhyme royal

BLAdd43491.First Lines:
Fresh amorouse sihts of countreys ferre and straungeHaue all
                    forddone your old affeccion…
BLAdd43491.Last Lines:
…For Master Paston the thyng whereon my blisseWas holly sette
                    is all fordoone I wysse
BLAdd43491.Note:
Robbins  and  Cutler (1965)
